main event: A police officer observed a transparent, round object with a metallic sheen in Kansas City on December 7, 1951.
interesting points: The object was seen at an altitude higher than a B-29 aircraft flying at 10,000 feet., The officer observed the object for about a minute before it disappeared., The object made no noise during the observation., The local weather bureau confirmed no weather balloons were present at the time of the sighting., The object's shape resembled a small airplane with stubby wings.
sighted object: a transparent, round object with a metallic sheen
witness description: Cpl. Frank Gibson, a member of the police department for seventeen years
